topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Working with HPE StoreVirtual VSA

body.p: The StoreVirtual option allows you to configure HPE StoreVirtual VSA cluster as storage.You can configure your StoreVirtual by either using the Horizon undercloud dashboard(Recommended) or Sirius client.
This page describes the different tasks that you can perform using the StoreVirtual option in the Horizon undercloud dashboard.

section.title: Before you begin
section.p: Before you start working with StoreVirtual, ensure that the following prerequisites have been fulfilled:

ol.li: HPE Helion Cloud is deployed
HPE StoreVirtual VSA cluster is created and is accessible by Cinder

section.title: Register a StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: Use the Horizon undercloud dashboard to register a cluster. When you register a cluster, it registers the cluster to the cloud inventory. The registered cluster can later be added as a back end to the overcloud Cinder.
To register the cluster using the Horizon undercloud dashboard, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the Horizon undercloud dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the Overview page.
Select the StoreVirtual option to activate it. The HPE StoreVirtual VSA page is displayed.
Click Register Cluster in the top-right corner of the page to display the Register Cluster dialog box.

li.p: In the dialog box, do the following:
In the Cluster Name box, enter the StoreVirtual cluster name.
Note: The cluster name is case sensitive
In the IP Address box, enter the virtual IP address of the cluster.
In the Subnet box, enter the subnet of the StoreVirtual cluster.
In the Username box, enter the user name to access the cluster.
In the Password box, enter the password to access the cluster.

ol.li:
Click Done to save the details.
On successful registration, the cluster is added and is listed as Registered.

section.title: Edit a StoreVirtual cluster
section.note: Ensure that you edit the StoreVirtual cluster only if there are any updates made through the CMC for the selected cluster. After editing the details, the backend data should also be updated so that the Cinder configuration file has the updated cluster information.
section.p: To edit a cluster, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the Horizon undercloud dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the Overview page.
Select the StoreVirtual option to activate it. The HPE StoreVirtual VSA page is displayed.
Click Edit Cluster to display the Edit StoreVirtual Cluster dialog box.
Make the required changes.
Click Done to save the changes.

section.title: Unregister a StoreVirtual cluster
section.p: Unregistering a cluster will remove it from the cloud inventory.
section.note: When you unregister a cluster,the volumes from this cluster backend will no longer be available through Cinder. Ensure that you detach all relevant volumes and remove the backend associated with the cluster before unregistering. After unregistering the cluster, the backend data should also be updated so that the Cinder configuration file has the updated cluster information.
section.p: To unregister a cluster, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the Horizon undercloud dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the Overview page.
Select the StoreVirtual option to activate it. The HPE StoreVirtual VSA page is displayed.
Click the More drop-down list next to the cluster you want to unregister and select Unregister Cluster. A confirmation box is displayed.
Click Unregister cluster to unregister or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Unregister multiple clusters
section.note: After unregistering the cluster, the backend data should also be updated so that the Cinder configuration file has the updated cluster information.
section.p: Use this option to unregister multiple clusters using a single command.

ol.li: Log in to the Horizon undercloud dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the Overview page.
Select the StoreVirtual option to activate it. The HPE StoreVirtual VSA page is displayed.
Click the checkbox next to the Name column to select all the clusters.
Click Unregister Clusters to unregister the clusters.A confirmation box is displayed.
Click Unregister Cluster to unregister or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: View configuration
section.p: Use this option to view the cluster configuration (as defined in the HPE Helion OpenStack Configuration Manual for HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual Block Storage Volume Driver).

ol.li: Log in to the Horizon undercloud dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the Overview page.
Select the StoreVirtual option to activate it. The HPE StoreVirtual VSA page is displayed.
Click the More drop-down list for the cluster whose configuration you want to view.
Click View Configuration. The StoreVirtual Cluster Cinder configuration is displayed in a dialog box.
